intro: Endostemon tenuiflorus, commonly known as the slender-flowered endostemon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Endostemon tenuiflorus is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
